intro: Bellucia arborescens, commonly known as the red-flowered bellucia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
